author: William Baldwin
title: Best ETFs: Stock and Bond Mixes
text:
Once upon a time a fund blending stocks and bonds would be called a balanced fund. Nowadays it’s likely use the fancier term “allocation.”Whether you are looking at an old balancer or a modern allocator, the question to ask is this: Can I make my own blend cheaper? Instead of buying the cheapest allocation fund, why not copycat its mix with a cheap bond fund and a cheap stock fund?If convenience compels you to buy the prepackaged product, consider the five offerings here from iShares. They are the best in the category.Rules for the Best ETFs scorecard, and links to 13 categories of funds, can be found here .
